Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Add files to an existing zip file
Top-3 Scripts:
so_44839636: #!/bin/bash

for zip in *.zip
do
    ZIPNOTES=$(zipnote "$zip")
    TRIMMED=$(echo "$ZIPNOTES" | sed -e 's/^@[ \t]\{2,\}\(.*\)/&\n@=\1/')
    echo "$TRIMMED" | zipnote -w "$zip"
done

#!/bin/bash
for zip in *.zip; do zipnote "$zip" | sed -e 's/^@[ \t]\{2,\}\(.*\)/&\n@=\1/' | zipnote -w "$zip"; done

Explanations about Options.-d(M):
Always create a containing directory for the contents of the unpacked archive. By
 default, a directory is created if there is more than one top-level file or folder.

Explanations about Options.-f(M):
Specify archive as the pathname of the input or output archive, overriding the
 default standard input (for list and read) or standard output (for write). A single
 archive may span multiple files and different archive devices. When required, pax
